abstract:
TensorLy is a python library that provides a high level API for tensor
methods and deep tensorized architectures. Tensor methods are natural
extensions of traditional matrix algebraic methods to higher orders.
While they have been extensively used in fields such as quantum systems,
signal processing and psychometrics, they only recently started to be
employed in Machine Learning. They have the potential to both help us
develop better theory about deep learning, and to leverage the
multi-dimensional structure in the data. After a short introduction to
tensor methods, I will present some way in which tensor methods can be
combined with deep learning, and demonstrate through Jupyter notebooks
on how easy it is specify tensorized neural networks.
description:
I will present some way in which tensor methods can be combined with
deep learning, and demonstrate through Jupyter notebooks on how easy it
is specify tensorized neural networks.
title: Keynote #2 - Tensorly: A Flexible Python Framework for Machine Learning
